propositions.text: The document is a raw text file that has undergone OCR or contains garbled characters.
Much of the original content is unreadable and cannot be reliably converted into structured Markdown.
The majority of the text consists of unintelligible characters and patterns that do not form coherent words or sentences in any known language.
It is impossible to identify headings, paragraphs, lists, code blocks, or academic citations with any accuracy.
A meaningful conversion to structured Markdown is not possible without a readable and coherent source text.

concepts.name: Raw text file
concepts.context: Describing the nature of the input document.

concepts.name: OCR
concepts.context: Mentioned as a potential cause for the document's state.

concepts.name: Garbled characters
concepts.context: Describing the unreadable content of the document.

concepts.name: Unreadable content
concepts.context: Characterizing the majority of the document's text.

concepts.name: Structured Markdown
concepts.context: The intended output format which is rendered impossible due to the document's state.

concepts.name: Coherent words/sentences
concepts.context: The absence of these in the document's text.

concepts.name: Readable source text
concepts.context: A prerequisite for meaningful Markdown conversion.

hierarchy.structure: The document is analyzed by first stating its nature (raw/garbled text), then detailing the consequences of this nature (unreadability, inability to identify structural elements), and finally concluding with the overall impossibility of the intended task due to the lack of a proper source text.
